translation: Now beings the description of Nara incarnation

gurmukhi: Ab bweIs√ço gin Avqwrw ]jYs rUp kh Dro murwrw ]nr Avqwr BXo Arjnw ]ijh jIqy jg ky Bt gnw ]1]
transliteration: Ab Baaisvo Gad(i) Avtaaraa|| Jais Roop Kah Ddaro Muraaraa|| Naravtaar Bhayo Arjanaa|| Jib Jeete Jag Ke Bhat Gadaa||1||
translation: Now I enumerate the twenty-second incarnation as to how he assumed this form. Arjuna became the Nara incarnation, who conquered the warriors of all the world.1.

gurmukhi: piRQm invwq kvc sB mwry ]ieMdR qwq ky Sok invwry ]buhro ju`D rudR qn kIAw ]rIJy BUiq rwt bru dIAw ]2]
transliteration: Pritham Nivaat Kavach Sabh Mdare|| Indra Taat Ke Shok Nivdare|| Bahuro Juddh Rudra Tan Keeaa|| Reejhe Bhoot(i) Raat Bar(u) Deeaa||2||
translation: In the first place, he by killeing all the warriors, weaing unfailing coat of mail, removed the anxiety of his father Indra; then he fought a battle with Rudra (Shiva), the king of ghosts, who bestowed a boon on him.2.

gurmukhi: bhur dRujoDn kh mukqwXo ]gMDRb rwj ibmuK iPr AwXo ]KwNfv bn pwvkoih crwvw ]bUMd eyk pYTY nhI pwvw ]3]
transliteration: Bahur Drujodhan Kah Mouktaayo|| Gaddhrab Raaj Bimoukh Phir Aayo|| Khaandav Ban Paavkoh(i) Charaavaa|| Boond Ek Paithai Nahipaavaa||3||
translation: Then he redeemed Duryodhana and burnt the king of Gandharavas in the fire of the Khandav forest; all these could not comprehend his secret.3.

gurmukhi: jau kih kQw pRsMg sunwaU ]gRMQ bFn qy hiRdY frwaU ]qwN qy QorIXY kQw khweI ]BUl dyiK kib lyhu bnweI ]4]
transliteration: Jau Kah(i) Kathaa Prasan Sounaaoo|| Granth Badhan Te Hridai Daraaoo|| Taan Te Thoreeyai Kathaa Kahaaee|| Bhool Dekh(i) Kabi Leh(u) Banaaee||4||
translation: My mind fears the enlargement of this Granth (Book) by relating all these stories, therefore I have said it in brief and the poets will themselves improves my mistakes.4.

gurmukhi: kaUrv jIq gwv sB AwnI ]BwNiq BwNiq qn mhwN AiBmwnI ]kiRSn cMd k`h bhuir irJwXo ]jwqy jYqpqR kh pwXo ]5]
transliteration: Kaoorav Jit Gadv Sabh Aanee|| Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Tan Mahaan Abhimaanee|| Krishan Channd Kahh Bahur(i) Rijhaayo|| Jaate Jaitpatra Kah Paayo||5||
translation: He conquered all the places, where several proud Kauravas lived; he pleased Krishna and obtained the certificate of victory from him.5.

gurmukhi: gwNgyv Bwnj kh mwrXo ]Gor BXwn AXoDn DwrXo ]durjoDn jIqw Aq blw ]pwvq Bey rwj Abclw ]6]
transliteration: Gadngev Bhaanaj Kah Mdaryo|| Ghor Bhayaan Ayodhan Dhdaryo|| Durjodhan Jitaa At Balaa|| Paavat Bhae Raaj Abchalaa||6||
translation: He killed Bhishma, the son of Ganga and Karan, the son of Surya after fighting a dreadful war with them; he conquered the mighty warrior Duryodhana and obtained the eternal kingdom.6.

gurmukhi: kh lig krq kQw khu jwaU ]gRMQ bFn qy ADk frwaU ]kQw biRD ks krO ibcwrw ]bweIsvo Arjn Avqwrw ]7]
transliteration: Kab Lag(i) Karat Kathaa Jaaoo|| Granth Badhan Te Adhak Daraaoo|| Kathaa Bridh Kas Karau Bichaaraa|| Baisavo Arjan Avtaaraa||7||
translation: Upto which doing I should narrate this story, because I greatly fear the enlargement of this volume; what should I think of the long story? I say only this that Arjuna was the twenty-second incarnation.7.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky nr Avqwr sMpUrxm squ ]22]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatke Nar Avtaar Sanpooranam Sat(u)||22||
translation: Here ends the description of Nara Incarnation in Bachittar Natak.22.
Now begins the description of the twenty-third Buddha incarnation

gurmukhi: Ab mY gno bauD Avqwrw ]jYs rUp kh Drw murwrw ]bauD Avqwr iehI ko nwaU ]jwkr nwv n Qwv n gwaU ]1]
transliteration: Ab Mai Gado Baudh Avtaaraa|| Jais Roop Kah Dharaa Muraaraa|| Baudh Avtaar Ebi Ko Naaoo|| Jaakar Naav No Thaav No Gadoo||1||
translation: Now I describe the Buddha incarnation as to how the Lord assumed this form; Buddha incarnation is the name of that one, who has no name, no place and no villate.1.

gurmukhi: jwkr nwv n TwNv bKwnw ]bauD Avqwr vhI phcwnw ]islw srUp rUp iqh jwnw ]kQw n jwh klU mih mwnw ]2]
transliteration: Jaakar Naav Na Thaanu Bakhaanaa|| Baudh Avtaar Vahipahchaanaa|| Silaa Saroop Roop Teh Jaanaa|| Kathaa No Jaah Kaloo Maih Maanaa||2||
translation: He, whose name and place are not described, he is only known as the Buddha incarnation; no one has accepted his sayings in the Iron Age, who visualizes the beauty only in stone (idols).2.
